intro: Ditassa macarenae, commonly known as the Macarena tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical climates and is often found in mountainous areas. Its botanical features include a straight trunk and dense foliage, making it a valuable ornamental plant. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
